abstract.p: Deutsche Bank AG sells about $2.4 billion worth of its shares in Allianz AG; Allianz stock price graph (S)

block.p: Europe's biggest bank, Deutsche Bank A.G., took another step toward unraveling itself from Germany Inc., selling about $2.4 billion worth of its shares in Allianz A.G., the Munich-based insurance conglomerate. Between them, Deutsche and Allianz have for decades been at the center of a web of German industrial cross-holdings that made the companies seem impregnable to outsiders. Deutsche sold some of its stake in Allianz last year, but the latest sale was bigger and the flood of shares knocked down the price of Allianz stock.

Europe's biggest bank, Deutsche Bank A.G., took another step toward unraveling itself from Germany Inc., selling about $2.4 billion worth of its shares in Allianz A.G., the Munich-based insurance conglomerate. Between them, Deutsche and Allianz have for decades been at the center of a web of German industrial cross-holdings that made the companies seem impregnable to outsiders. Deutsche sold some of its stake in Allianz last year, but the latest sale was bigger and the flood of shares knocked down the price of Allianz stock.
